event.title: was named thus by an Act in March 1785

data.event: Darlington County was named thus by an Act in March 1785.
The settlement of what is now Darlington County began in earnest after 1736 and 1737 when the province of South Carolina set aside a vast area of land for the Welsh Baptists of Delaware.

event.title: 1737 when the province of South Carolina set aside

data.event: The settlement of what is now Darlington County began in earnest after 1736 and 1737 when the province of South Carolina set aside a vast area of land for the Welsh Baptists of Delaware.
For almost thirty years settlers concentrated on the banks and small tributaries of the Pee Dee River.
